body: 1: Northern Ballet: 1984 Jonathan Watkins is making a name for himself with adaptations of literary works. Following his acclaimed version of A Kestrel For A Knave, he turns his hand to Orwell. Sadler’s Wells, EC1, Tue to 28 May  2: What Remains… Anatomy Of An Artist This short festival premieres 10 new works inspired by creative minds including Samuel Beckett and Fred Herko. Among the participating choreographers are Julie Cunningham and veteran maverick Ian Spink. Siobhan Davies Studio, SE1, Sat & Sun  3: International Dance Festival Birmingham As this ever-excellent festival comes to a close, highlights include a celebration of Bollywood and bhangra and an all-female triple bill from Ballet British Columbia. Various venues, to Sun
webTitle: Three of the best… dance performances this week
